thread.title: Three killed, 29 hurt as bus falls into gorge
thread.title_full: Three killed, 29 hurt as bus falls into gorge

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Three killed, 29 hurt as bus falls into gorge
text:
Tribune News Service
Mussoorie, October 19
Three persons were killed and 29 were injured when a Srinagar-bound bus fell into a gorge, near Jakhand (Takoli) village, in Tehri district today. A joint team of the police and district disaster response reached the spot and retrieved the bodies from the gorge. The injured were taken to the Srikot government hospital. While one deceased has been identified as Sohan Singh, a resident of Gangnali Srikot in Tehri Garhwal, the identities of the other two are yet to ascertained. The condition of five of the injured is stated to be critical. Meanwhile, one person was killed while another was injured when their tractor overturned on the Maili Kund road in Rudprayag district today. The deceased has been identified as Padam Bahdur (19), a resident of Hapur village in Nepal and the injured as Ramesh Bhadur(18), a resident of Rajpur village in Nepal. Chief Minister Harish Rawat and Governor KK Paul expressed grief over the loss of precious lives and prayed for the speedy recovery of the injured.
